metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5982 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the Chorus2 2.4.2 add-on for Kodiallows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a %2E%2E%252e (encodeddot dot slash) in the image path, as demonstrated byimage/image%3A%2F%2F%2e%2e%252fetc%252fpasswd.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5982` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kodi - 2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
kodi-bin - 2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
kodi-data - 2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
kodi-eventclients-common - 2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
kodi-eventclients-kodi-send - 2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
kodi-eventclients-ps3 - 2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
kodi-eventclients-wiiremote - 2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
kodi-gbm - 2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
kodi-repository-kodi - 2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
kodi-wayland - 2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
kodi-x11 - 2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kodi package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:18.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu1').
